content: I believe it needs to provide an incoming server (IMAP or POP) and an SMTP server for Thunderbird to use it.
creator: davidsk

content:
I spoke at length with Apple support today after failing to get an iCloud email address accepted on Thunderbird. Outlook and Windows Mail. Apple requires an App Specific Password, different from the Apple ID password needed to access the Apple account & therefore iCloud email in IOS & IPadOS Apple provides a web page to create this ASP. The dialog prompts for a reference name like "Thunderbird" after which it generates an Apple strong password in the form aaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd' (all lower case, no numbers) This password format doesn't comply with Apple's own PW requirements for its Apple ID [UPPER CASE, lower case, numeric, min 8 characters. A special character is optional.] By clicking on the + symbol the user is invited to enter a user defined password. This is also repeated for confirmation. However, once the User defined PW is complete and OK'd by the user, Apples website ignores it and again creates its own PW in the form aaaa.bbbb.cccc.dddd. I don't know whether a user defined PW would be the solution because it's impossible to test this. I suggest anyone having this problem checks out the creation of an Apple ASP here:

https://appleid.apple.com/account/home

Please contact Apple Support if you find the same as me. We must get this working because Thunderbird is an excellent email client.
creator: Lozzerdude

content: That is what 'all mail' means - all mail. This is controlled by Gmail. You may find it beneficial to remove Allmail and rely on Trash.
creator: davidsk

content:
david said
That is what 'all mail' means - all mail. This is controlled by Gmail. You may find it beneficial to remove Allmail and rely on Trash.

I have so far been unable to validate the claim that Gmail controls the new/unread email badges shown in Thunderbird. In fact, it seems that GMail is showing the new/unread badge/count as desired.

Removing "All Mail" and relying on "Trash" has not been found to be beneficial.
creator: brandon27

content:
This and other threads I have found explain why this issue occurs and mention "removing" or "unsubscribing" from the All Mail and Important folders. None of these explain (beyond mere hints unhelpful to novice users) how to do that.

Knowing why is great, but it's not enough without knowing how.
creator: fb.shopping17

content: Okay, - highlight account in left sidebar - rightclick and select 'subscribe' - untick the folders you do not want to see Yes, I should have mentioned that originally.

creator: stephen109

content: My guess is that you are not seeing the menu bar. Click the Alt key and it should appear. To keep it in view, click view>toolbars>menubar. With the menu bar, you should see view>sort by>unthreaded. After doing that for a folder, you can then click the icon at right side of message list pane, and select the 'apply current view to' menu as documented elsewhere.
creator: davidsk

content: You will need to give detailed information on your email host and the error message you are receiving. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
L'account è di tipo POP3 o IMAP?

Se è IMAP, quali cartelle sono sottoscritte per la sincronizzazione? -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/sincronizzazione-imap#w_configurazione-della-sincronizzazione-ed-utilizzo-dello-spazio-sul-disco
creator: @next

content:
next ha detto
L'account è di tipo POP3 o IMAP? Se è IMAP, quali cartelle sono sottoscritte per la sincronizzazione? -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/sincronizzazione-imap#w_configurazione-della-sincronizzazione-ed-utilizzo-dello-spazio-sul-disco

Grazie per la risposta. L'account è di tipo IMAP, la sicronizzazione avviene per tutte le cartelle eccetto "spam/indesiderata" e "cestino", quindi la "posta inviata" è tra quelle sincronizzate, in ogni caso le impostazioni dell'account Outlook sono le stesse dell'account Gmail e le stesse di un altro provider che utilizzo, ma il comportamento è diverso, evidentemente nell'account Outlook ci deve essere qualcosa di diverso, forse non proprio dipendente da Thunderbird. Con la configurazione automatica, Thunderbird mi ha proposto il server smtp.office365.com, ma ho provato anche con quello che utilizzavo prima smtp-mail.outlook.com e il risultato non cambia.
creator: led.vol

content: [RISOLTO] nelle impostazioni di Thunderbird, per l'account Outlook in "Cartelle e copie", ho tolto la spunta a "Copia il messaggio" dopo l'invio. Ora quando invio un messaggio con Outlook, sia dal client Thunderbird sia dalla webmail, in posta inviata appare una sola copia del messaggio inviato.
creator: led.vol

content:
Looks like the Inbox is acting like a Drafts folder.

See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1420998 for a similar issue.
creator: sfhowes

content: Controlling spam for mailing lists is not a Thunderbird issue. My suggestion is to do a web search for managing spam with mailing lists. From my own experience issues such as content, links to other sites, verification of sending address all come into play.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks for your reply David. My emails are usually about 10 words and with no attachments. This problem has only occurred in the past month. From the 50 odd emails sent, I am unaware how many finish in the recipient's spam folder but so far I have been advised by 6 people which never happened B4. When I try to send the 50 emails as one post the message says that there are too many addresses and assumed to be all spam. My provider has tried to fix but says it is a Thunderbird problem. I do not have the problem if using Gmail
creator: barryd1

content: You are using a different IP address when using Gmail online.
creator: davidsk

content: Do you have the folder pane set to Unified Folders?
creator: wsmwk

content: Many thanks for your reply. Yes, it's set to Unified Folders. The account in question appears in 'All Folders', but only with Inbox, not with other Folders and Sub-folders which I have created. Other accounts display ok in Unified Folders and in All Folders with folders and sub-folders.
creator: marchmont

content:
re :The account in question appears in 'All Folders', but only with Inbox, not with other Folders and Sub-folders which I have created.

Uncheck the 'Unified' for now. Using 'All' only... Did you try to subscribe to see folders?

  • Right click on imap mail account name in Folder Pane and select 'Subscribe'
  • click on 'Refresh'
  • Select folders and subfolders and click on 'Subscribe'
  • click on 'OK'

Did this get all folders to reappear ?
creator: Toad-Hall
